title: Aleppo Codex
summary: The Aleppo Codex (Hebrew: כֶּתֶר אֲרָם צוֹבָא‎, romanized: Keter Aram Tzova, lit.  'Crown of Aleppo') is a medieval bound manuscript of the Hebrew Bible. The codex was written in the city of Tiberias in the 10th century CE (circa 920) under the rule of the Abbasid Caliphate,[1] and was endorsed for its accuracy by Maimonides. Together with the Leningrad Codex, it contains the Ben-Asher masoretic tradition.
